Cell.Data: Walk around with <font color="#c5b14d">{action player_rebindable skill_weapon_or_move} or the left joystick</font>. Head North and interact with the ladder to ascend the cliff.
Walk around with the <font color="#c5b14d">left stick</font>. Head North and interact with the ladder to ascend the cliff.
Walk around with the <font color="#c5b14d">left stick</font>. Head North and interact with the ladder to ascend the cliff.
You can trade an Enneract with Demetra for Primordial Affinity, which is used to level up skills at her shop.
Increasing the level of a skill unlocks spell modifiers. Use <font color="#c5b14d">{action player_rebindable ui_skilltree}</font> to open the Active Skills menu.
Skills can also level up while being used in combat.
You have received an Enneract, an ancient magical device.\n\n<font color="#c5b14d">Right-Click</font> the Enneract in your inventory to learn a new skill.
<font color="#c5b14d">Right-Click</font> the Enneract in your inventory to learn a new skill.

â¢ Interact with enemies to attack them. If youâre using a controller, an icon will indicate your current target. When wielding a <font color="#72c6db">Melee Weapon</font>, you will automatically <font color="#72c6db">Dash Attack</font> enemies. This dash has a cooldown.\n\nâ¢ Perform an <font color="#72c6db">Active Dodge</font> to evade enemy attacks. <font color="#72c6db">Active Dodges</font> have a small window of invulnerability and require <font color="#9cba7b">Stamina</font> points, which are recovered over time.

â¢ You are low on <font color="#f03a3d">Health</font>. If you run out of <font color="#f03a3d">Health</font>, you will go down.\n\nâ¢ Use your <font color="#f03a3d">Health Potion</font> to heal up. <font color="#72c6db">Potions</font> refill as you defeat enemies.

â¢ Use Skills with the Secondary Attack button. Skills require either Willpower or Rage to be cast.\n\nâ¢ The types of Skills you can cast are based on your equipped Weapon. Consult your Active Skills by opening the Skills panel.

â¢ By killing the monsters of Wolcen, you have grown in power and gained a level. â¢ Use the Character Sheet button to open your Character Sheet and assign points to the 4 different Attributes. Each Attribute affects different aspects of your character. â¢ Use the Gate of Fates button to open the Gate of Fates and assign Gate of Fates points.
â¢ You have found a <font color="#72c6db">Waypoint</font>. Open the <font color="#72c6db">World Map</font> then select a <font color="#72c6db">Waypoint</font> to teleport to that location.

â¢ Use the <font color="#72c6db">Town Portal</font> to return to the <font color="#72c6db">Stormfall</font> hub. You can return there whenever you need to and a <font color="#72c6db">Portal</font> will bring you back to your initial location.

â¢ Strong enemies are immune to crowd-control effects such as <font color="#72c6db">Stun</font> or <font color="#72c6db">Freeze</font>. Instead, hits that should inflict these effects deplete their <font color="#72c6db">Break Bar</font>. Once their <font color="#72c6db">Break Bar</font> has been fully depleted, the enemy will be <font color="#72c6db">Broken</font> for a very short time, and take increased damage from all sources. Use that opportunity to inflict as much damage as you can!

â¢ You are about to receive an <font color="#72c6db">Enneract</font>, an ancient magical device. Use the <font color="#72c6db">Enneract</font> in your <font color="#72c6db">Inventory</font> to learn a new <font color="#72c6db">Skill</font>.

â¢ Increasing the level of a <font color="#72c6db">Skill</font> unlocks <font color="#72c6db">Skill Modifiers</font> that you can activate from the <font color="#72c6db">Skills and Modifiers menu</font>.

â¢ <font color="#72c6db">Skills</font> can level up while being used in combat.

â¢ <font color="#72c6db">Gems</font> are special items that, once socketed to another item, can add magical effects to it or your character. An item needs <font color="#72c6db">Sockets</font> for <font color="#72c6db">Gems</font> to be inserted into them. There are many <font color="#72c6db">Gem</font> types to discover, and each one has a different effect depending on the <font color="#72c6db">Socket</font> type it is inserted into.\n\nâ¢ To insert a <font color="#72c6db">Gem</font> into a <font color="#72c6db">Socket</font>, move the <font color="#72c6db">Gem</font> into the <font color="#72c6db">Socket</font>. You can buy <font color="#72c6db">Gems</font> from <font color="#72c6db">Zenefer Stark</font> in the Stormfall market, and she even can remove <font color="#72c6db">Gems</font> from their <font color="#72c6db">Socket</font> for a price.

â¢ In her last moments, Mizzeonth fully unlocked the sleeping potential within you, allowing you to embody the <font color="#72c6db">Aspects</font> of Primordial beings.

â¢ Open the <font color="#72c6db">Aspects of Apocalypse menu,</font> then unlock the <font color="#72c6db">Aspect</font> you wish to use. Other <font color="#72c6db">Aspects</font> can be unlocked later in the game and can be switched at any time once unlocked.

â¢ Fill the <font color="#72c6db">Primordial Essence</font> meter by killing monsters. Once it is full enough, you can transform into a devastating celestial being. When transformed, your <font color="#72c6db">Primordial Essence</font> depletes over time, when you use skills, or when you take hits. When it is fully depleted, you will transform back into your human form.

Use your <font color="#72c6db">Aspect</font> wisely, as it can help you when overwhelmed by monsters.

â¢ All <font color="#72c6db">Attributes</font> increase by one when you level up. You are also given 10 <font color="#72c6db">Attribute points</font> to assign freely with every level you gain.\n\nâ¢ You can reset your assigned <font color="#72c6db">Attribute points</font> in your Character Sheet by spending <font color="#efd373">Gold</font>.

â¢ You are given 1 <font color="#72c6db">Gate of Fate point</font> each time you level up, up to a total of 89, and a further 2 additional points are unlockable through the Champion of Stormfall game mode. Assign your <font color="#72c6db">Points</font> and <font color="#72c6db">Confirm</font> them.\n\nâ¢ You can turn the <font color="#72c6db">Gate of Fates</font> using the ring interface, allowing you to mix and match nodes freely. Resetting your assigned <font color="#72c6db">Gate of Fates points</font> will cost you <font color="#8664aa">Primordial Affinity</font>.</Data></Cell>

â¢ This is the <font color="#72c6db">Skills</font> panel. All of the <font color="#72c6db">Active Skills</font> you have learned are here, and they can be dragged to any slot of your <font color="#72c6db">Skill Bar</font>.\n\nâ¢ You can also activate various <font color="#72c6db">Modifiers</font> for each <font color="#72c6db">Active Skill</font>, which will change or enhance their behaviour depending on their rank. Each <font color="#72c6db">Modifier</font> has an associated cost, so only a limited amount of them can be active at the same time. <font color="#72c6db">Modifiers</font> can be unlocked by increasing the <font color="#72c6db">Skill Level</font>.

â¢ Zanafer Stark, the <font color="#72c6db">Jeweller</font>, sells <font color="#72c6db">Gems</font> and will offer to remove any <font color="#72c6db">Gems</font> currently socketed to an item for gold.\n\nYou can also ask her to reroll the sockets of an item for gold.

â¢ This is Demetraâs shop, also known as the <font color="#72c6db">Archivist</font>. She can take <font color="#8664aa">Primordial Affinity</font> you have harvested from Enneracts to increase the <font color="#72c6db">Level</font> of <font color="#72c6db">Active Skills</font> you have learned.\n\nâ¢ She can also sell you <font color="#72c6db">Enneracts</font> for <font color="#efd373">Gold</font>.

â¢ This is your <font color="#72c6db">Inventory</font>. Any <font color="#72c6db">item</font> that you pick up will end up here. Here you can move, use, drop (if using a controller), or equip any item present in your <font color="#72c6db">Inventory</font>. To discard an item when using a mouse, drop it to the ground by moving it outside of the panel.

â¢ You have just been given your first <font color="#72c6db">Ethereal Reagent</font>. These are used to make alterations to the current <font color="#72c6db">Magic Effects</font> on any items you may have. There are four different <font color="#72c6db">Reagents</font>, each having their own effect on the <font color="#72c6db">Magic Effect</font> of your items.

â¢ Each <font color="#72c6db">Reagent</font> comes in Normal and Legendary versions: Normal <font color="#72c6db">Reagents</font> can only be used on Rare or Magic items; Legendary <font color="#72c6db">Reagents</font> only on Legendary items.

â¢ From your <font color="#72c6db">Inventory</font>, use the <font color="#72c6db">Reagent</font> of your choice to open the <font color="#72c6db">Crafting menu</font>. Then, select the item (Weapon, Armour, or Accessory) on which you want to apply the <font color="#72c6db">Reagent</font> in the left socket. From there, you can see which effect will be randomly removed (indicated by a red â sign) and learn more about the possible magic effects you will obtain with the <font color="#72c6db">'More details'</font> button.
â¢ You have obtained your first <font color="#72c6db">Dye</font>. To apply it to your armour, open the <font color="#72c6db">Cosmetic Inventory</font>.

â¢ This is the <font color="#72c6db">Cosmetic Inventory</font>. Here, you can apply armour <font color="#72c6db">Dyes</font> that you have learned for a fee. To do that, select the <font color="#72c6db">âDyesâ</font> tab, select which armour section you want to dye, and then select which colours you would like to apply to each <font color="#72c6db">Colour Slot</font>.

â¢ You can also change the <font color="#72c6db">Skin</font> of any item you have equipped to the <font color="#72c6db">Skin</font> of another item. Available <font color="#72c6db">Skins</font> are listed on the left, under the <font color="#72c6db">âSkinsâ</font> tab. Any new item you pick up for the first time will be unlocked as a <font color="#72c6db">Skin</font> for all your characters, so pay attention!

â¢ You can open the <font color="#72c6db">Cosmetic Inventory</font> by selecting its icon in your <font color="#72c6db">Inventory</font>.

â¢ Welcome back to the <font color="#72c6db">Archivist</font> window. Now that one of your <font color="#72c6db">Skills</font> has reached the appropriate level, you can begin to create further duplicates of your <font color="#72c6db">Skills</font>. To duplicate a <font color="#72c6db">Skill</font>, simply open its levelling tab and click <font color="#72c6db">"Duplicate"</font> once you have the necessary resources.\n\nâ¢ Duplicating your <font color="#72c6db">Skills</font> allows you to assign different modifiers to each duplicate, allowing you to tailor each of your <font color="#72c6db">Skills</font> to deal with different kinds of scenarios. Note that each duplicate of a <font color="#72c6db">Skill</font> will level independently from the other duplicates you own.
Interact with an item on the ground to transfer it to your <font color="#72c6db">Inventory</font>. You can inspect any item you pick up in your <font color="#72c6db">Inventory</font>.

â¢ <font color="#72c6db">Fast Travel</font> allows you to quickly travel to any <font color="#72c6db">Waypoint</font> that you have unlocked.\n\nâ¢ To <font color="#72c6db">Fast Travel</font> to an unlocked <font color="#72c6db">Waypoint</font>, open the <font color="#72c6db">World Map</font> and select the <font color="#72c6db">Waypoint</font> you wish to travel to. This will transport you instantly to the other <font color="#72c6db">Waypoint</font>, but unlike the <font color="#72c6db">Town Portal</font>, using <font color="#72c6db">Fast Travel</font> will not leave a <font color="#72c6db">Portal</font> that allows you to return to your previous location.

â¢ Congratulations, you have completed all three chapters of Wolcenâs campaign. The last 6 months since the events at the Conflux have been a blur, and now it seems that the noble houses of Stormfall have seen fit to appoint you the Regent of their city.\n\nâ¢ As Regent, you will manage the city of Stormfall and continue to grow your characterâs strength and abilities. To begin your duty, you can talk to <font color="#72c6db">Thunderblade Zalahir</font>, or open the <font color="#72c6db">Stormfall Overview Screen</font>.

â¢ Welcome to the <font color="#72c6db">Stormfall Overview Screen</font>. From here, you can access various <font color="#72c6db">Buildings</font>. Each <font color="#72c6db">Building</font> can unlock various gameplay features like a fifth skill slot, more personal stash tabs, your final <font color="#72c6db">Aspect of Apocalypse</font>, and more.

â¢ To access a <font color="#72c6db">Building</font>, simply select its corresponding icon. Once within a <font color="#72c6db">Building</font>, you will need to launch a <font color="#72c6db">Construction Project</font> to unlock its functions. To help you understand what these functions are, each building has a <font color="#72c6db">Tutorial</font> that can be accessed by selecting the <font color="#72c6db">Question Mark</font> icon in the top right corner of each <font color="#72c6db">Building's</font> window.

â¢ At the moment, the <font color="#72c6db">Stormfall Palace</font> is already constructed, and you will need to complete <font color="#72c6db">Projects</font> there if you are to unlock the <font color="#72c6db">Construction Projects</font> of each <font color="#72c6db">Building</font>. Open the <font color="#72c6db">Stormfall Palace</font> window now by selecting its icon.

â¢ This is the <font color="#72c6db">Stormfall Palace</font>, your new home as Regent. From here, you can initiate <font color="#72c6db">Projects</font> that will increase the cityâs total <font color="#72c6db">Productivity</font>, as well as the number of <font color="#72c6db">Projects</font> you can have active at any one time. Every <font color="#72c6db">Project</font> needs a set amount of <font color="#72c6db">Productivity</font> to complete, so the more that is generated by Stormfall, the faster <font color="#72c6db">Projects</font> will be completed.\n\nâ¢ Certain <font color="#72c6db">Palace Projects</font> also need to be completed before you can initiate a <font color="#72c6db">Building Construction Project</font>. For example, the <font color="#72c6db">Seekers Garrison</font> requires you to invest in <font color="#72c6db">Training Facilities</font> before it can be constructed. Go ahead and select the <font color="#72c6db">Training Facilities Project</font>, then <font color="#72c6db">âStart Projectâ</font> to begin. Active <font color="#72c6db">Projects</font> will be listed on the left side of the screen.

This is the <font color="#72c6db">Mandates Board</font>, where you can start exploring simple dungeons for loot. Once you have accepted a <font color="#72c6db">Mandate</font>, go through the portal to begin.

â¢ This is the <font color="#72c6db">War Table</font>. It offers a selection of <font color="#72c6db">Operations</font> you can carry out to protect Stormfall. In doing so, each completed <font color="#72c6db">Operation</font> will grant you rewards that will help you tackle greater challenges.

â¢ You will have to choose among three different <font color="#72c6db">Operations</font>, each with its own risks and rewards. A new set of activities will be available once an <font color="#72c6db">Operation</font> is completed.

â¢ This is also where you can use any <font color="#72C6DB">Special Mission</font> items in your inventory or personal chest. Select the <font color="#72C6DB">Consumables</font> button at the <font color="#72C6DB">War Table</font> to see what is available.

â¢ Congratulations, you have completed your first <font color="#72c6db">Project</font>. Now that the <font color="#72c6db">Training Facilities</font> have been completed, you can begin the <font color="#72c6db">Construction Project</font> for the <font color="#72c6db">Seekers Garrison</font>. Or, if you would like to construct a different building, select its icon and find out which <font color="#72c6db">Palace Project</font> needs to be completed, and then initiate that <font color="#72c6db">Project</font>.\n\nâ¢ Once you are happy with the <font color="#72c6db">Projects</font> you have initiated, complete an <font color="#72c6db">Operation</font> to end a <font color="#72c6db">Turn</font>, which will allocate your total <font color="#72c6db">Productivity</font> to each active <font color="#72c6db">Project</font>.

â¢ Welcome to the <font color="#72c6db">Seekers Garrison</font>. Here you can start unique <font color="#72c6db">Projects</font> called <font color="#72c6db">Seeker Expeditions</font>. <font color="#72c6db">Seeker Expeditions</font> send Seekers to different locations throughout the world of Wolcen. Each <font color="#72c6db">Seeker Expedition</font> has a different kind of reward attached to it, related to the environment the Seekers will be exploring.

â¢ Note that <font color="#72c6db">Seeker Expeditions</font> have a chance of failure. Some locations are harder to get to than others. Other locations require ships to get to, so you will need to build the <font color="#72c6db">Shipyard</font> before you can access those.

â¢ New <font color="#72c6db">Seeker Expeditions</font> are available each <font color="#72c6db">Turn</font>.

Have a look at your available <font color="#72c6db">Seeker Expeditions</font> now.

â¢ Welcome to the <font color="#72c6db">Trade Assembly</font>. Here can start unique <font color="#72c6db">Projects</font> called <font color="#72c6db">Diplomatic Missions</font>. These <font color="#72c6db">Missions</font> dispatch Diplomats to different societies and cultures scattered throughout Wolcen. Each <font color="#72c6db">Mission</font> has a different kind of reward attached to it, based on a key aspect of the culture your diplomats are visiting.

â¢ Keep in mind that <font color="#72c6db">Diplomatic Missions</font> have a chance of failure. Some places are more difficult to get to, increasing the chance of failure. Other locations require ships to get to, so you will need to build a <font color="#72c6db">Shipyard</font> before you can access those.

â¢ New <font color="#72c6db">Missions</font> are available each <font color="#72c6db">Turn</font>.

Take a look at your available <font color="#72c6db">Missions now</font>.

â¢ Welcome to the <font color="#72c6db">Dark Market</font>. Here, you can begin <font color="#72c6db">Projects</font> that will allow you to procure improved versions of the items in your possession, obtain <font color="#72c6db">Reagents</font>, and transform <font color="#72c6db">Reagents</font> into their legendary counterparts. In order to access these <font color="#72c6db">Projects</font>, you will first need to establish their corresponding <font color="#72c6db">Contact</font> in the <font color="#72c6db">Dark Market</font>.

â¢ Welcome to the <font color="#72c6db">Transmutation Forge</font>. Here you can carry out <font color="#72c6db">Transmutation Projects</font>; these <font color="#72c6db">Projects</font> allow you to take an item from your inventory and transmute it into a random item of the same category, quality, and rarity once the <font color="#72c6db">Project</font> has been completed.

â¢ This means that weapons will only transmute into another weapon, and not an armour part or accessory; the transmuted item will also not be of the same type as the item you placed in the forge. For example, a dagger would not become another dagger.

â¢ To begin transmuting an item, drag the item you wish to transmute into the <font color="#72c6db">"Insert Item"</font> slot and select <font color="#72c6db">"Start Project"</font>.
â¢ Welcome to the Diamond Bank. Here you can begin <font color="#72c6db">Projects</font> that will unlock additional tabs for your <font color="#72c6db">Personal chest</font>. .

â¢ Welcome to the <font color="#72c6db">Anankis Artefact</font> window. Here, you can begin a Project to recover an <font color="#72c6db">Artefact</font> discovered in Anankis. Doing so will unlock its power, giving you access to the final <font color="#72c6db">Aspect of Apocalypse</font> unlock.

â¢ Welcome to the <font color="#72c6db">Enneract Laboratory</font>. Here, you can unlock the feature that will allow Demetra to duplicate your <font color="#72c6db">Skills</font>. Completing the first <font color="#72c6db">Project</font> allows you to duplicate any <font color="#72c6db">Skill</font> once. In order to duplicate a <font color="#72c6db">Skill</font> a second time, you will have to upgrade the <font color="#72c6db">Enneract Laboratory</font>.

â¢ Welcome to the <font color="#72c6db">Siphon Chamber</font>. After a period of calibration, this device allows Demetra to siphon <font color="#8664aa">Primordial Affinity</font> from your body, and give you gold in return. Effectively, this <font color="#72c6db">Projects</font> allows you to convert <font color="#8664aa">Primordial Affinity</font> into <font color="#72c6db">Gold</font>. \n\nSelect how much <font color="#8664aa">Primordial Affinity</font> you would like to convert into <font color="#72c6db">Gold</font>, and begin the <font color="#72c6db">Project</font> to initiate the conversion process.

â¢ Welcome to the <font color="#72c6db">Energy Instillator</font>. Once it has been calibrated, this device allows Demetra to transfer <font color="#8664aa">Primordial Affinity</font> into your body. The amount of <font color="#8664aa">Primordial Affinity</font> you receive is based upon how much <font color="#72c6db">Gold</font> you offer her - think of it as a way of converting your <font color="#72c6db">Gold</font> into <font color="#8664aa">Primordial Affinity</font>.\n\nâ¢ Simply determine how much <font color="#72c6db">Gold</font> you would like to convert into <font color="#8664aa">Primordial Affinity</font>, and begin the <font color="#72c6db">Project</font> to initiate the conversion process.

â¢ You will need to complete a <font color="#72c6db">Turn</font> before your <font color="#72c6db">Productivity</font> is allocated to the <font color="#72c6db">Project</font>. In order to complete a <font color="#72c6db">Turn</font>, you will first need to successfully complete an <font color="#72c6db">Operation</font>. The harder the challenge, the more <font color="#72c6db">Productivity</font> will be added to your various <font color="#72c6db">Projects</font>. But fail, and the <font color="#72c6db">Turn</font> will not pass. \n\nâ¢ Go to the <font color="#72c6db">War Table</font> now and select an <font color="#72c6db">Operation</font> to undertake.

<font color="#72c6db">Buildings</font> give access to various features through <font color="#72c6db">Projects</font>. You must first start the <font color="#72c6db">Construction Project</font> of a <font color="#72c6db">Building</font> before you can access its other <font color="#72c6db">Projects</font>.

Every <font color="#72c6db">Project</font> requires a set amount of <font color="#72c6db">Productivity</font> to be completed. At the end of every <font color="#72c6db">Turn</font>, Stormfall's <font color="#72c6db">Productivity</font> is allocated to each of your active <font color="#72c6db">Projects</font>.\n\nIncrease your base <font color="#72c6db">Productivity</font> by constructing <font color="#72c6db">Buildings</font> and completing <font color="#72c6db">Projects</font> in the <font color="#72c6db">Palace</font>.

You can see your active <font color="#72c6db">Projects</font> and their progression on the left.\n\nOnce a <font color="#72c6db">Project</font> has started, cancelling it will not refund its base cost and you will have to start it over.
A Turn is completed when successfully finishing an <font color="#72c6db">Operation</font> from the <font color="#72c6db">War Table</font>.

Complete an <font color="#72c6db">Operation</font> from the <font color="#72c6db">War Table</font> to end the <font color="#72c6db">Turn</font>. The harder the challenge, the higher the <font color="#72c6db">Productivity</font> bonus is at the end of the <font color="#72c6db">Turn</font>, allowing you to complete <font color="#72c6db">Projects</font> faster.

â¢ You have found a <font color="#72c6db">Pet</font>. Open your <font color="#72c6db">Inventory</font>, then select the Paw icon in the bottom-left corner to open the <font color="#72c6db">Pets</font> menu and choose a Pet that will follow you on your journey.\n\nâ¢ During your exploration, your <font color="#72c6db">Pet</font> will pick up the gold obtained from monsters, chests, and destructible elements for you within in a certain radius. Note that <font color="#72c6db">Pets</font> do not assist you during combat.

â¢ Welcome to your first <font color="#72c6db">Hunt</font>! Each <font color="#72c6db">Hunt</font> ends in a fight with your <font color="#72c6db">Prey (Secondary Boss)</font>. If you can track them down and defeat them, you will be rewarded.

â¢ The <font color="#72c6db">Hunt</font> has started. Pick up and follow the <font color="#72c6db">Trail</font> left by your <font color="#72c6db">Prey</font> to find <font color="#72c6db">Traces</font>.

â¢ Finding <font color="#72c6db">Traces</font> brings you one step closer to your <font color="#72c6db">Prey</font> and deepens your knowledge of the <font color="#72c6db">Enemy</font> that you will face at the end of the <font color="#72c6db">Hunt</font>.

â¢ Your <font color="#72c6db">Pet</font> will highlight <font color="#72c6db">Trails</font> and lead you to the next <font color="#72c6db">Trace</font> left behind by your <font color="#72c6db">Prey</font>.

â¢ Once you have found a <font color="#72c6db">Trace</font>, you will be given <font color="#72c6db">Choices</font> that will alter the nature of the <font color="#72c6db">Hunt</font>. These <font color="#72c6db">Choices</font> can be <font color="#72c6db">Events</font>, <font color="#72c6db">Boss Modifiers</font> added to your <font color="#72c6db">Prey</font>, or <font color="#72c6db">Map Modifiers</font>. The <font color="#72c6db">Difficulty</font> and <font color="#72c6db">Rewards</font> of the fight with your<font color="#72c6db"> Prey</font> will be determined by your <font color="#72c6db">Choices</font>.
Select an Operation by choosing a figurine from the War Map.
The number of Diamonds represent the Threat level of the Operation. The higher the Threat level, the fiercer the enemies.
This icon represents the rarity and type of reward you will gain by completing the Operation. Keep an eye out for Operations that will give you exactly what you are looking for!
Unlock higher difficulty levels by gaining enough Skulls. Skulls will only be awarded for completing an Operation at the highest available difficulty.
This panel gives you information on the currently selected Operation.
Click on the âArea Modifiersâ card to access a screen where you can spend Gold to activate Area Modifiers and earn bigger rewards.
This panel indicates the rewards you will receive from the Operation. The rewards, magic find, and productivity depend on the Area Modifiers and Difficulty tier chosen, as well as the Operation type.
Click on the Shield icon to access the Difficulty Selection screen.
Pay 2,500 gold to choose 1 Area Modifier out of 3 to make the Operation more challenging.
The list of chosen modifiers is then displayed here.
The more modifiers you have activated, the greater the rewards.
Choose a Difficulty tier by clicking on its corresponding Shield.
Choose a specific Difficulty level by clicking on its numbered icon.
You can view how many Skulls you need to unlock the next Difficulty tier.
